name: Hilton Melbourne South Wharf

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were going to an event at the convention centre, which is why we splurged a little and stayed here. The location was perfect for us. The lobby was nicely decorated and had a fantastic Archibald art display which is worth a look.
reviews.title: Good location for convention centre/ casino

reviews.text: The room itself was spacious and comfortable with all expected amenities. Bed was large and comfy although I'd have liked a choice of pillow as they weren't very supportive. The bathroom was nicely laid out with plenty of bench space.
reviews.title: simply the best breakfast in a hotel anywhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like many hotels, the lighting in the room was too dark. They could use a main light in the bedroom & shower but at least they had a cosmetic mirror with light in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Service not the best

reviews.text: Room service was really hit and miss. We had butter chicken that I couldn't even eat it was so bad but the burger and lasanga were great. They messed up our room service breakfast order and only gave us one fork. I've had better buffet breakfasts at some resorts but this one was pretty good. We ate at the Sotano tapas bar and although the drinks and food were good there was a 15 min gap bwteen bringing out my meal and the last one for the table - for a table of 6.
reviews.title: A great stay!

reviews.text: the heading says it all worth going there just for brekkie,,,,we stayerd there on alads week for spring carnival last nov,,,a great pick,,simply no faults at all,,,,location was brilliant bar and food was very good ,,,,they even have a salsa club in the bar i think on sunday or saturday night free as well...a great salsa live band too....the gym was excellent for an hotel...rooms were spotless and modern fittings ...short walk to the casino and the south bank attractions ..i will definitely return there in the future,,!!!!
reviews.title: A good experience at Hilton

reviews.text: Great location close to CBD. The DFOs are next door to the hotel.The service was great and the buffett breakfast is the best I have ever had which included a do it yourself fresh juice machine. The casino is close and and even if you do not gamble the food outlets are amazing.
reviews.title: escape
Most comfortable beds in Australia!
reviews.text: The bell boys at the Hilton are delightful under extreme wheather conditions and do not expect a tip!!!.

This is one of my favourite hotels in Oz and NZ! I never get a better nights sleep - even in my bed at home! They have the most comfortable beds, the rooms are lovely and the staff are friendly and attentive. Excellent location in Melbourne - I never stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: Luxurious

reviews.text: Every comfort you could ask for in the heart of the city. Excellent service and good value for money. Easy walk to the Crown Casino and Etihad Stadium and conveniently located near the heart of Melbourne.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked through wotif and were amazed to find that for a very resonable rate we were in an executive suite. ( I think it must have been a special)
reviews.title: A good stay

reviews.text: This was my 3rd stay at Hilton South Wharf, and my second in their fabulous 2 bedroom apartments. IMO there is really no better place to stay in Melbourne if you are travelling with a friend. The apartments are spacious, luxurious and offer an amazing view over the city.
reviews.title: Another Fantastic Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first time staying at Hilton as a Gold VIP and I was very impressed with the recognition and added extras offered at check in.
reviews.title: Fabulous Faultless Hotel with most Amazing View!

reviews.text: The staff in this hotel, from the front door to the room service, yet again impressed me with their attention to detail and excellent customer service.
reviews.title: Nuevo 37 Restaurant - Best Spanish Paella in Melbourne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm already looking forward to my next stay :)
reviews.title: Great hotel in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here 3 times now and every time we experienced faultless customer service! The room has one of the most spectacular views of all the hotels we have stayed in! Looking straight up the Yarra River this is amazing in the morning watching the sunrise and as the sun sets the reflections on the windows of the city with the lights shiny through is equally amazing! The beds are so comfortable and the room is a perfect size! The staff and customer service were fabulous and faultless ! There is no comparison !
reviews.title: Good hotel - but not stellar.

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 weeks in June on a Business Trip. Hotel is conveniently located at the south bank next to the river, minutes from the freeway. Rooms are spacious, very clean with full length view. Next to the DFO for shopping and Convention centre and 10 to 15 minutes walk to Crown Casino. Staff are friendly and helpful. Internet and parking is expensive. International Breakfast has a good spread as well. Only miss is the lack of a pool. Executive lounge is huge though I did not make use of it.
reviews.title: Excellent Service Good Location Business Friendly

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights. Right next to the Convention Center, and a block away from Crown Casino. Too bad I did not have reason to visit either.
reviews.title: MEL Hilton South Wharf - Rm1216
Public areas are a little sterile, but the rooms are good
reviews.text: Room is normal standard size, and had modern fixtures and decor. However it did not provide slippers and the room lighting was too dim for my taste. Internet is a whopping AUD29+++
I think I need to find better value hotels around.
reviews.title: Fun Girls Weekend Away!

reviews.text: This is close to where I do business in Melbourne so it is a handy location and I have stayed here a few times. Also adjoins the convention centre. I Have always found the public areas a little sterile and unfriendly, but I like the rooms, which are modern and slick and have all the mod cons you would expect from a recently built hotel. They have a nice modern feel to them which I like. I recommend trying for a city view room as the view down the river is pretty good.
reviews.title: Very close to Melbourne Convention Centre

description: Synonymous with quality, service, and style, Hilton offers the best of Melbourne.Immerse yourself in riverside cool that is the innovative Hilton Melbourne South Wharf. This upper upscale hotel is located in dynamic South Wharf Promenade and only a short stroll to the CBD, Docklands, Southbank dining precinct and Etihad Stadium - and beside the premium DFO South Wharf. The hotel offers spectacular city views, and mouth-watering dining and drinking options at Nuevo37 restaurant and Sotano Wine + Tapas bar. It has sophisticated private event spaces, and a unique conference offering with partner Melbourne Convention & Exhibition Centre. •Stylish riverside hotel on South Wharf Promenade, next to DFO South Wharf•Internal access via first floor link to Melbourne Convention & Exhibition Centre•Executive Lounge with outdoor terrace•396 generous rooms with spectacular views of the city or bay•60 Executive rooms and 54 Yarra, Relaxation and Two-Bedroom Suites•Four-point bathrooms with Peter Thomas Roth® amenities•Sophisticated Nuevo37 restaurant•Authentic Sotano Wine + Tapas Bar•Casual all-day Caffè Cino•24-hour Hilton Fitness by Precor®
